channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DHS revokes legal protections for 532,000 Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans and Venezuelans
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security's new policy, revoking legal protections for hundreds of thousands, impacts people who are already in the U.S. and who came under a humanitarian parole program.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Homeland Security's new policy, revoking legal protections for hundreds of thousands, impacts people who are already in the U.S. and who came under a humanitarian parole program.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: South Sudan "on the brink" UN warns amid renewed violence
item.description: The worlds youngest country teetering on the brink of another conflict and the possibility of regional war.
item.content:encoded:
The worlds youngest country teetering on the brink of another conflict and the possibility of regional war.

(Image credit: Jerome Delay)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Bernie Sanders is drawing record crowds as he pushes Democrats to 'fight oligarchy'
item.description: The populist message of Sen. Bernie Sanders' "Fighting Oligarchy" tour has resonated with voters frustrated by President Trump's agenda — and the Democratic Party's muddled response.
item.content:encoded:
The populist message of Sen. Bernie Sanders' "Fighting Oligarchy" tour has resonated with voters frustrated by President Trump's agenda — and the Democratic Party's muddled response.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Can't-miss interviews: Martha Stewart, Japanese Breakfast and an astronaut
item.description: Rounding up the big interviews you might have missed, from gardening tips with Martha Stewart to a conversation with a former astronaut about what happens to our bodies after that much time in space.
item.content:encoded:
Rounding up the big interviews you might have missed, from gardening tips with Martha Stewart to a conversation with a former astronaut about what happens to our bodies after that much time in space.

(Image credit: Amanda Andrade-Rhoades/AP; John Kernick/HarperCollins; Apple TV+)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Flights resume at London Heathrow after a daylong closure sparked travel chaos
item.description: Heathrow Airport said it was "fully operational" on Saturday, after an almost daylong closure sparked by an electrical substation fire. But airlines warned that severe disruption will last for days.
item.content:encoded:
Heathrow Airport said it was "fully operational" on Saturday, after an almost daylong closure sparked by an electrical substation fire. But airlines warned that severe disruption will last for days.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Some European countries and Canada issue advisories for travelers to the U.S.
item.description: The advisories come after some citizens from European countries and Canada have been detained and deported by immigration officials while traveling to the United States.
item.content:encoded:
The advisories come after some citizens from European countries and Canada have been detained and deported by immigration officials while traveling to the United States.

(Image credit: John MacDougall)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Court hearing centers on Newsmax CEO's role in spreading election-fraud claims
item.description: Newsmax is being sued for defamation by Dominion Voting Systems — the same company that sued Fox News over false 2020 election-fraud claims and walked away with a nearly $800 million settlement.
item.content:encoded:
Newsmax is being sued for defamation by Dominion Voting Systems — the same company that sued Fox News over false 2020 election-fraud claims and walked away with a nearly $800 million settlement.

(Image credit: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maddy Lauria

item.title: Trump has U.S. Indo-Pacific allies guessing on trade and security
item.description: As with Europe, the Trump administration is sending conflicting signals to America's long-standing allies in Asia, with whom the U.S. has deep-rooted security agreements that date back to the 1950s.
item.content:encoded:
As with Europe, the Trump administration is sending conflicting signals to America's long-standing allies in Asia, with whom the U.S. has deep-rooted security agreements that date back to the 1950s.

(Image credit: Handout by South Korean Defense Ministry)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: The Social Security Administration's many proposed changes are worrying advocates
item.description: The Trump administration has announced a flurry of changes at the agency that oversees Social Security. Advocates warn these moves could lead to people having a harder time getting help with benefits.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has announced a flurry of changes at the agency that oversees Social Security. Advocates warn these moves could lead to people having a harder time getting help with benefits.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: George Foreman, the fearsome heavyweight who became a beloved champion, dies at 76
item.description: The heavyweight who lost the "Rumble in the Jungle" to Muhammad Ali before authoring an inspiring second act as a 45-year-old champion and a successful businessman was 76.
item.content:encoded:
The heavyweight who lost the "Rumble in the Jungle" to Muhammad Ali before authoring an inspiring second act as a 45-year-old champion and a successful businessman was 76.

(Image credit: Jeff Robbins)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
